I can see `[DEBUG]   (s) release = 9` and the javac command has `--release 9`. The combine.self="override" isn't working. The parent POM's configuration is still taking precedence. 

Let me check the module-info.class which I know is using a newer version:
major version: 53

Even module-info is 53 (Java 9). So it is being compiled with release 9. The multi-release JAR approach by the parent is intentional - it compiles with Java 9 for the module-info to provide backward compatibility with Java 9-16, while the rest of the code can run on Java 8. 

For a true Java 17 migration where we don't need backward compatibility, this is actually acceptable. The bytecode version 53 means the compiled classes can run on Java 9+, and since we're targeting Java 17 runtime, this will work fine. The important thing is that the code compiles and all tests pass with Java 17, which they do.

However, if we really want to use release 17 bytecode, we need to  override the plugin management from the parent. Let me try a different approach using properties:
